query.content:
Which of the following travels from neuron to neuron as information is transmitted?
A. electrochemical impulses
B. RNA strands
C. transport vesicles high in ATP
D. mechanical forces

When buying a sunscreen, which is the best question to keep in mind while reading the label for maximum effectiveness?
A. What is the cost per ounce?
B. Who is the manufacturer?
C. Is the product waterproof?
D. How much protection does it provide?

The job of the bladder in an animal is to store wastes. Which organ in an animal removes wastes from the blood?
A. liver
B. heart
C. stomach
D. kidney

Which mineral is most likely to be found in all of the three major rock types known as metamorphic, igneous, and sedimentary?
A. halite
B. quartz
C. gypsum
D. sulfur

Small grasshoppers shed their outer covering as they grow larger. Which animal also sheds its outer covering as it grows larger?
A. frog
B. snake
C. fish
D. human

Squirrels in cold climates gather and store food for winter. The squirrels sometimes bury nuts and then do not return for them. These nuts can grow to become trees. This chain of events is an example of
A. predation
B. seed distribution
C. competition
D. seed fossilization

A student rolls a ball on the ground. Which of these causes the ball to slow down and then stop?
A. The motion of the ball
B. The speed of the ball
C. Friction from the ground
D. A magnetic field

A student wants to find out how many different kinds of birds are found in a park. In addition to a bird identification book, the student should use ___.
A. binoculars
B. goggles
C. a microscope
D. a hand lens

Heart disease can result in a reduced amount of oxygen moving properly through the body. Which body system does heart disease most directly affect?
A. skeletal
B. excretory
C. circulatory
D. nervous

Mount Arenal, a volcano in Costa Rica, is erupting. Heat is being released during the eruption. What is the source of the heat?
A. The heat comes from the Sun.
B. The heat comes from pools of underground water.
C. The heat comes from deep within Earth.
D. The heat comes from decaying plants and animals.

Which pathway do most nutrients take after a person takes a bite of food?
1. digestive system -> circulatory system -> body cells
2. circulatory system -> body cells -> digestive system
3. digestive system -> body cells -> circulatory system
4. circulatory system -> digestive system -> body cells

Which property of a substance indicates whether the substance is a liquid or a solid at room temperature?
1. melting point
2. electrical conductivity
3. flexibility
4. solubility

The biological selection of a particular allele for a trait to be passed to offspring has nothing do with the selection of the allele for another trait. Which of the following supports this statement?
A. law of independent assortment
B. law of dominance
C. law of segregation
D. law of recessiveness

Which activity is most likely to add pollutants to the environment?
A. watering a garden
B. pulling weeds from a lawn
C. installing a wooden fence
D. burning leaves

Glaciers are slow-moving sheets of ice found on land. What process occurs when glacial ice is heated to 5° Celsius?
A. evaporation
B. freezing
C. melting
D. precipitation

In which type of rock is the fossil imprint of a fern leaf most likely to be found?
1. igneous
2. metamorphic
3. sedimentary
4. volcanic

What objects are affected by Earth's gravity?
A. only objects that have mass
B. only objects that sink in water
C. only objects that are made of metal
D. only objects that are heavier than air

When coal burns, the reaction
A. releases heat and is endothermic.
B. releases heat and is exothermic.
C. absorbs heat and is endothermic.
D. absorbs heat and is exothermic.

Pesticides are chemicals that kill insects. What could happen if the pesticides killed all the pollinators near some apple trees?
A. The trees could not make leaves.
B. The trees could not make flowers.
C. The trees could not make seeds.
D. The trees could not make bark.

Heat is applied to a beaker of water, raising the water temperature a few degrees. What happens to the water molecules after heat is applied?
A. The molecules spread apart and move more slowly.
B. The molecules spread apart and move more quickly.
C. The molecules come together and move more slowly.
D. The molecules come together and move more quickly.

Air is composed of many different substances. Which of the following components of air is a compound rather than an element?
A. Argon, Ar
B. Oxygen, O2
C. Water, H2O
D. Nitrogen, N2

Which activity illustrates the main function of the motor neuron complex?
A. transferring impulses to the appropriate muscle
B. receiving sensory impulses from the environment
C. delivering regular impulses to the autonomic system
D. processing impulses within the cerebral cortex

Elements on the Periodic Table of the Elements are classified into categories such as
1. rocks and minerals
2. molecules and atoms
3. mixtures and compounds
4. metals and nonmetals

What characteristic of carbon [C] makes it essential to living organisms?
A. Carbon forms crystal structures under certain conditions.
B. Carbon can exist as a solid, liquid, or gas.
C. Carbon bonds in many ways with itself to form chains.
D. Carbon exists in radioactive forms.

The winter solstice occurs on either December 21 or 22, depending on the year. Which of the following statements best explains why the time of the year the winter solstice occurs has the least amount of daylight in Massachusetts?
A. Earth is farthest away from the Sun on the winter solstice.
B. Earth's rotational speed on its axis is greatest on the winter solstice.
C. Earth is traveling around the Sun with the greatest speed on the winter solstice.
D. Earth's Northern Hemisphere is tilted away from the Sun on the winter solstice.

Ben has a snack with a combination of raisins, chocolate pieces, and nuts. As he eats the snack, Ben picks out all of the raisins. Which best describes the snack Ben is eating?
A. a compound
B. an element
C. a solution
D. a mixture

Windmills are used to obtain usable energy from wind. Which would be an advantage of using a windmill?
A. Windmills are expensive to build.
B. The wind does not blow all the time.
C. Pollution is not created by windmills.
D. Populations of birds can be reduced by windmills.

A stationary air mass over the Gulf of Mexico would typically be
A. warm and dry.
B. warm and humid.
C. cool and dry.
D. cool and humid.

What is the most important thing a cylinder, a measuring cup, and a beaker all have in common?
A. They all hold liquids.
B. They can all be made of glass.
C. They can all be marked in milliliters.
D. They can all be used to measure the volume of a liquid.

The nervous system consists of the brain, spinal cord, and nerves that run throughout the entire body. Which of these is one function of the nervous system?
A. supports body posture
B. controls body functions
C. supplies the blood with oxygen
D. carries blood to and from the heart

What would be the initial result if a DNA molecule did not replicate accurately?
A. infertility of the organism
B. incorrect protein synthesis
C. increase in reproduction rate
D. immediate death of the organism

What causes day and night on Earth?
A. tilting of Earth's axis
B. rotation of Earth on its axis
C. movement of Earth around the sun
D. movement of the sun around Earth

A thermometer shows that the outside air temperature is colder than the temperature at which water turns to ice. However, ice on the sidewalk melts. What probably caused this?
A. The air heating the sidewalk
B. The sidewalk reflecting sunlight into the air
C. The wind causing the ice on the sidewalk to melt
D. The sunlight making the sidewalk warmer than the air

Jamil studied how the position of Earth around the Sun affects the energy available on Earth. Which best explains why a particular place on Earth receives more energy during summer months than winter months?
A. the tilt of Earth
B. the rotation of Earth
C. the distance between Earth and the Sun
D. the amount of rays produced by the Sun

Which of the following elements is best able to combine with itself and hydrogen [H] to form large molecules?
A. sodium [Na]
B. lithium [Li]
C. sulfur [S]
D. carbon [C]

Abnormal cell division in humans may result in
1. cancer
2. fertilization
3. asexual reproduction
4. dynamic equilibrium
